==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|しん|ら|ばん|しょう|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
{{compound|森羅|万象|lang=ja}}: Shinra Banshō (森羅万象; Literally meaning "All-Covering Forests and Ten Thousand Things") is a Buddhist idiom which has come to mean "All of Nature" or "All of Creation".

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|しんら ばんしょう}}

# {{lb|ja|idiomatic|Buddhism}} All [[thing]]s in [[nature]].
